definition: gang of bandits/criminal gang (formerly often used of political opponents)
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: The counter-revolutionary gang was on the rampage for a time, but before long it was completely overthrown.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗一時的反革命匪幫，曾幾何時，遭到了徹底覆滅。

sentences.english: It was the last crime the bandit gang committed last year.
sentences.chinese: 這是匪幫去年犯的一樁最惡劣的罪行。

sentences.english: In nature autarchy is the fixed stationary bandit.
sentences.chinese: 專制國家本質上等於固定下來的匪幫。
歡迎光臨明星匪幫風格。

sentences.english: No north inner-city gang was involved in Cahill's murder.
sentences.chinese: 市北部的地區的匪幫沒有參與謀殺卡荷爾。

sentences.english: The town used to be infested with bandits in the old days.
sentences.chinese: 這個鎮從前常遭到匪幫的騷擾。
